steps.txt: Welcome to Westward's tutorial. We'll cover building, trading and crafting. These activities are only a small part of what you can do in the game, but that should get you started!
In addition, we'll try to convey how every single of these activities has an essential collaborative aspect to it!
But first... that's you, right here, in the middle of the screen. That's your character.
To move, simply click somewhere in the grass. Go ahead, try it!
Great! All other actions take place by clicking on things, and will be covered throughout the rest of the tutorial.
See these [B11]s? They have been built by other players. Apparently, you are not alone around here.
In Westward, players can build various buildings more or less anywhere to fulfill their needs and help them survive.
This is a construction site. Looks like someone is building a [B3]. That will be very useful to craft important items.
Let's see how the construction is going. Click on the construction site to enter it.
Buildings are built by bringing construction material to them.
Looks like [I3] is needed. Perhaps you could help? Exit the building by clicking on the door icon.
You can acquire [I3] by building a [B6]. It'll generate [I3] for you automatically at regular intervals.
The resources of the land deplete as players extract them, hence the continuous march Westward to keep finding new ones and expanding!
To build a building, first open the 'Build' menu by clicking on the shovel icon, here on the left.
Find the [B6] and click on it.
Now pick a location to build it. It will only be possible next to a forest; get closer to the forest to the east and build it there. (Click back on the shovel to cancel)
Contrary to the [B3] you visited, this building doesn't require construction material, so it's built immediately!
Enter your [B6] by clicking on it.
Production normally takes a bit of time, but for the sake of the tutorial, your building has magically produced [I3] in an instant!
Since you own this building, you can take anything from it's stock. Click on the [I3] icon and take it all.
Now exit your building and go back to the [B3] under construction.
You can contribute to a building's construction by giving material freely, or by selling it for money.
Let's be altruistic for now. Click on the button to give all your [I3].
Great! The [B3] has been built! It'll be essential to the local community's survival.
As you can see, players can complement and help each other, freely or for gold, to create settlements that will help them survive.
Now let's have a look at crafting. Find and click the [I28] recipe in the recipes panel. [I28] is a nice first weapon to have.
To make [I28], you need [I7], [I26] and [I21]. Let's see if the nearby [B4] doesn't sell any of it. Leave the [B3] and enter the [B4] to the north west of it.
You are in luck, there is [I21] for sale. This means a player crafted it somewhere else and sold it here. Click on it and buy it!
Now, to find some [I7]. Exit the building and search around the forest. Click on items to pick them up.
Great, now pick up some [I26].
Now go back to the [B3], and craft one [I28].
This covers crafting. You helped build a [B3], which in turn allowed you to craft something you needed.
In addition, to obtain some ingredients, you went to the shop of another player to buy what yet another player had produced.
You must be tired after all that. See the golden heart icon above? It represents your vigor. It decreases when you perform actions.
The lower your vigor, the more you will get maluses to your other stats, making you very vulnerable. The best way to replenish it is to rest somewhere.
By now your [B6] must have produced enough [I3] for you to build your own [B11]. Go ahead and build one!
Enter your [B11]
As you can see, the longer you stay in your [B11], the more you rest. It also works when you are offline!
This is the end of the tutorial for now. It's not complete yet, other aspects will be covered in the future!
